text: Schwarz mit reichlich dunkelbraunem Schaum. R√∂stmalzig, Kaffee, etwas Laktose, dezent s√§uerlich, leicht bitter.
Keg at ushers. Pours black, nose is coffee, caramel, hint of raspberry and blueberry, taste is roasted, bitter, coffee, creamy, fruity.

330 ml. bottle bb 07/03/19. Jet black pour with a big foam that settles to a half inch of sponge. Huge nose penetrates the oversized head with high quality espresso. Occasional touches of dry cocoa, roasted peanut and caramel. Flavor is espresso, caramel, whole grain bread, roasted peanut and milk chocolate in an excellent proportion. Medium body has smooth, low-medium CO2 and a very nice dark malt, dry slant balanced by some caramel and lactose.

Bottle 0,33L. Courtesy of Gregor. Black color with average big, creamy, light brown head and excellent lacing. Aroma of black coffee and chocolate dominates. Taste starts light sweet and very coffee-ish. Finish gets some bitterness with some dark chocolate & caramel. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Excellent brew!

330ml bottle. Pours black colour. Modest beige head. Coffee, chocolate, notes of bread, slight nutiness in the aroma. Lots of coffee. Coffee, coffee beans, notes of bitter chocolate. Coffee and bitterness in the aftertaste. Low carbonated, medium bodied, solid brew.

330ml bottle @ the office. Pours an opaque black with a small tan head. Nose is roasted, coffee, and hints of green pepper. Flavour is rich, semi-sweet, and quite tasty, lots of roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Yum

Dark brown. Medium head. Rich coffee nose, but lots of brown sugar and Mexican chocolate. On the palate, sweet, nice, has the same sweet brown sugar notes...complex, delicious. I really like this. Complex and delicious.
Bottle - Tons of dark roast coffee and dark chocolate. Jet brown with a decent brown head. Huge roasty coffee and lots of bitter dark roast. Lovely.
Aroma is dark fruit/mild vinous, dark malts and a unique earthiness. The flavor is dark malts, lactic acid, coffee, mild dark fruit and a dry/acidic finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. Du≈Ñska odpowied≈∫ na Founders Breakfast Stout. Jeszcze bardziej ≈õniadaniowe ni≈º Beer Geek Breakfast :p
Black with slow settling brown foam head, lasting, lacing. Strong coffee aroma (even after being muffles by foam(, also coffee strongly present in taste. Good. (Velp 201704)

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 330ml bottle (Sip, Tallinn)
Nasty heavy burnt mess, some coffee, but some ashtray, pretty nasty. Dark, tight tan head. Slightly better in the taste, burnt roasty coffee, not quite an ashtrayey. Full smooth palate, would be fairly pleasant if it wasn¬ít for the harsh burntness in the finish. Very underwhelming brew, quite unpleasant. Probably an overrate.

330ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Very dark brown color. Medium size, yellowish head, stays. Coffee, roast, sweet, dry in aroma. Coffee, alcohol, sweet, spicy in taste. Soft tingly hops. Something going on in here, but it¬ís weird. Average brew.

Bottle (from SIP). Pours black with dark brown head. The head stays. Aroma is intense coffee, beans, roast, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, stale coffee, malt, roast. Finish is coffee bitter. Overall: this coffee is way too stale and way too sweet for me...

Black pour with a beautiful tan head and lots of sticky lacing .... aroma of coffee, licorice, cocoa, roasted malts and caramel malts ..... taste is of bitter roasted coffee, licorice, cocoa, dark malts, caramel malts and lactose sugar ..... dusty and earthy cocoa .... has a light bitterness to it with lots of lingering coffee and mostly licorice ..... mouthfeel is slick and oily with lots of depth and character ..... abv hidden well ... one of the best stouts I¬íve ever had hands down

Data wa≈ºno≈õci:  07.03.2019 
 Kolor:  Czarny, ca≈Çkowicie nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Gruba, puszysta z≈Ço≈ºona z drobnych i ≈õrednich be≈ºowych oczek.
Po kilku minutach pƒôka do du≈ºych oczek. Gruba oponka dryfuje po powierzchni. Ka≈ºdy wypity ≈Çyk odciska siƒô kolejnƒÖ wstƒôga na szkle.
Piana piƒôknie zdobi ka≈ºdy milimetr firmowego kielicha.
Po wypiciu ca≈Çego piwa piana wciƒÖ≈º pozostaje w szkle! 
 Zapach:  Umiarkowanie trwa≈Çy aromat kawy. Solidna s≈Çodowa baza, odrobina zbo≈ºa i lekka palono≈õƒá.
W tle nuty gorzkiej czekolady.
Aromat ≈õrednio intensywny, ale przyznaje, ≈ºe piwo jest jeszcze za zimne, aby w pe≈Çni siƒô otworzyƒá. 
 Smak:  Je≈õli mamy tutaj do czynienia ze Stoutem to z ca≈ÇƒÖ pewno≈õciƒÖ jest to American Stout. 
PojawiajƒÖ siƒô tutaj wyra≈∫ne przes≈Çanki wskazujƒÖce na obecno≈õƒá ameryka≈Ñskiego chmielu.
Jest intensywa ≈ºywiczna, le≈õna strona, jest tez odrobina cytrus√≥w w tle.
Kawa jest obecna, ale jest delikatna i nie przyt≈Çacza piwa bazowego.
Mamy za to konkretnie zbudowanƒÖ s≈ÇodowƒÖ bazƒô w kt√≥rej g≈Ç√≥wnymi elementami jest wypieczony chleb, lekki karmel, odrobine orzech√≥w, ciasto typu keks (ciasto biszkoptowe z bakaliami).
Czekolada jest kolejnym nieod≈ÇƒÖcznym fragmentem trunku. Nie za mocna, gorzka, taka w sam raz.
Laktoza dodana do Stouta nada≈Ça mu wyra≈∫nego kremowego odczucia w ustach.
Masywna tekstura i niesamowita g≈Çadko≈õƒá i lekko≈õƒá spo≈ºycia.
Wow! Klasa! 
 Wysycenie:   

Pokazowy Stout, taki jaki mo≈ºna uznaƒá za wz√≥r stylu. Nie przegiƒôty w ≈ºadnƒÖ stronƒô.
Doskonale wywa≈ºony. Nie za s≈Çodki, niezbyt wytrawny, dok≈Çadnie w sam raz.
Kawa, kt√≥ra stonowi≈Ça g≈Ç√≥wny dodatek nie by≈Ça przyt≈ÇaczajƒÖca, nie dominowa≈Ça bazy i nie zas≈Çania≈Ça ca≈Çej reszty sk≈Çadowych.
Piwo znika ze szk≈Ça w kilku ≈Çykach, a to stanowi o jego najwiƒôkszej sile.
Chapeau bas Mikkeller & Friends! Po raz kolejny udowadniacie swoje miejsce w elicie ≈õwiatowego piwowarstwa.

Chapeau bas Mikkeller! Once again you prove your place in the elite of world brewing!

Bottle. Teku. Pitch black with moderate to high, densed, light brown head. Perfect head retention and lacing. Mainly moderate to heavy roasted malts aroma - first of all freshly brewed coffee, in the background some espresso notes, along with dark fruits character (prob. roasted malts in conjunction with coffee acidity). Taste is moderately sweet with light bitter and acidic notes, finish is coffee, ashy and lightly bitter. Medium body, creamy and oily texture, soft carbonation. In overall nice coffee-based stout, very nice, thick, creamy and silky body. 4.0 for the style.

Bottle. Very dark brown with a generous brown bubbly head that collapses into a thick persistent mattress. Lovely coffee and cocoa aroma. Very full bodied with fresh ground medium roast coffee bean character, creamy undertones, roast and dark chocolate. Very well balanced with an excellent coffee character. Really delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours pitch blach with small beige head. Aroma of fresh roasted coffee, condensed milk and caramel. In taste some high bitterness as basis, with a strong sweet accent in the finish. Very creamy and full bodied.
(Tap) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of weeds, roast, then some jam; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
Bottle. Deep dark colour with creamy brown head off. Aroma of coffee, nuts, cookies. Taste of dark chocolate, nuts, coffee, plumbs, alcohol, moderate carbonation, bitter coffee finish.
LCI. Awesome stout. Thickbodies, lots of aroma and flavour, mostly coffee and roasted malts. This is how I like my stout!
Bottle. Deep coffee aroma. Pours black and thick, and feels like that in the mouth. Delicious interplay of coffee, booziness and creaminess. Brilliant stuff.

Bottle at home. Pours pitch black, with generous beige head, which lasts quite a bit. Heavy, fresh roasted coffee beans aroma. Tastes hops, a bit of sweetness, cocoa, heavy roasted coffee beans aroma. It is smooth and creamy. Gorgeous stout with low ABV.
Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva. shared with JFK10000. Pours black with nice dense lasting light brown head. Nice coffee aroma. Roasted malts, coffee, cocoa, bitter finish. Medium bodied. Nice one.

Szinte fekete sz√≠n, m√©g a habja is s√∂t√©tbarna. T√∂m√©ny k√°v√©illat. K√∂zepesen testes, nem t√∫l √©des, de nem is t√∫l keser≈±. Az arany k√∂z√©p√∫t. Az alkoholt szinte √©szre sem venni. bottle thanks alberto dark good head intense coffee nose good dryness roasty bit astringent
 scura schiuma piuttosto abbondante metallico un filo astringente chicco. Caffe
I¬ím gonna fall right in line with the 4¬ís here. This dark brown stout has a heavy roast and decent amount of coffee with a cocoa powder bittersweet finish. Quite nice.

Bottle shared at Luppolo Station, Rome-Italy. Black pour, huge brownish foam. Nose: cocoa powder, much coffee. Mouth: coffee, a bit bitter, cocoa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33l at Majstor za pivo Belgrade, Serbia. 30.12.2016. Pour it dark color with small black head. Aroma of roasted malt, roasted coffee. Taste of cocoa, coffee beans, roasted fresh coffee, pinch of vanilla, nice balanced, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium to full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Perfection!

Hatalmas, √∂r√∂kk√© tart√≥, t√∂m√∂r, barna hab, koromfekete sz√≠n. P√∂rk√∂lt mal√°t√°s, k√°v√©s illat. Mark√°ns, k√°v√©s, p√∂rk√∂lt mal√°t√°s √≠zvil√°g, enyhe savanyk√°s mell√©k√≠zzel, jelz√©s √©rt√©k≈± aszalt gy√ºm√∂lcs√∂kkel. Sz√°raz, m√©gis kr√©mes, k√∂zepesen testes √©s sz√©nsavas, er≈ësen keser≈±. Ahogy melegszik, halv√°ny alkoholoss√°g is el≈ëb√∫jik. Nekem kicsit t√∫l sz√°raz.

Schiuma marrone, fine e abbondante, persistente. Nera impenetrabile.
Odore intenso tostato, caff√®, orzo tostato, cioccolato, cuoio.
Sapore tostato, caff√®, fruzzantezza molto bassa, setosa in bocca, bon equilibrio tra i sapori e l¬íalcool. Buona.

On tap at Apex, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out rich espresso beans, some earthiness and dry powdery cocoa. Flavour is rich, with tons of espresso beans, light sweetness and medium roast. Finishes on lightly sweet chocolate notes and espresso. Delicious coffee stout.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with full dark tan head. Aromas of rich malty chocolate, cafe au lait, vanilla, and dark sugar. Flavors of sweet coffee, dark chocolate, and smooth dry roasted malts. Wonderful, especially for 6%,

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Kaffestout ].Clear dark black brown color with a large to huge, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, light brown head. Aroma is heavy malty, coffee, roasted, strong coffee, dusty coffee - malt. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, coffee bitter, roasted, sweet coffee - mocha. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160515]
 8-4-8-4-16

Pours black with a tan head.
Nose shows heavy coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, chocolate liqueur.
Flavours include heavy roasted malt and heavy coffee.

Bottle from Mikkeller web shop cons 2016-12-08 G√∂teborg 
AR: rich fruity African coffey, truffles 
AP: black, high high dens black lid
F: rich fruity African coffey, truffles

Bottle shared by Joes. Opaque black color, medium to full sized brown head that lasts for quite a long a time. Aroma is malts, mocha, coffee and chocolate. Taste malts, coffee, chocolate, dark malts, dark chocolate, mocha, moderately bitter, malt bitter and chocolate bitter. Quite easy drinkable but full flavored.

The perfect coffee-stout: pours like espresso, black with a small brown head and sticky lacing. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee, notes of cocoa. Taste is for coffee lover: very strong espresso, with its lingering bitterness, with heavy notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Great in its style!
Bottle. Black, minimal head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.
Black colour, dark brown head. Aroma of coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is light to medium bitter, light sweet. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Pretty nice.

Pours a pitch black color with medium brown head. Taste has lots of green coffee beans, roasted malts, lactose and roastiness. Taste follows the nose, intense coffee flavours, lactose, cocoa powder, grass and roasted malts. Bitter aftertaste. Very tasty Stout.

Chocolate coffee oatmeal aroma, bomb. Dark chocolate coffee bitterness. Pleasant roasted coffee with hoppy bitterness. Really awesome. Not sweet or twisted with anything yet it¬ís really complex and tasty.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Pitch black, thick dark espresso head. Big coffee aroma, grounded coffee, coffee candies, only slightly sweet and not overly roasted. Similar flavour, full of coffee and not too sweet, with a layer of moderate hoppy bitterness. Medium body, good mouthfeel. Overall, it¬ís coffee overdrive, completely obscuring the malts, but still nice and tasty.

Barwa nieprzejrzy≈õcie czarna, piƒôkna, ciemnobe≈ºowa piana, trwa≈Ça, zostawiajƒÖca ≈Çadny lacing. Kawa dominuje zar√≥wno w aromacie, jak i w smaku. Wysycenie ≈õrednie, wyczuwalna kwa≈õno≈õƒá od ciemnych s≈Çod√≥w, goryczka niska. PorzƒÖdny Coffee Stout, ale niczym nie powala.

Dal color ebano scuro, quasi nero, con un cappello di schiuma nocciola abbondante,cremoso e dalla lunga tenuta. Al naso fave di cacao e caff√® molto intensi. Al palato il corpo si mostra vellutato e nella media, birra con carbonazione bassa. In bocca entra subito decisa con note di cioccolato fondente extra, ancora caff√® e sul f8nale vira verso un amaro deciso dato dal tostato, con qualche venatura terrosa.
Pitch black colour with no head.Aroma is sweet of dark dried fruits and coffee,even some licorice nots malty and with good full body.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium creamy brown head. Smell: coffee, roasted malt, licorice. Sweet. Black bread. Taste: full body, really creamy with roasted malt exposition. Good balance, coffee very drinkable. Good attenuation. Creamy finish. Aftertaste: roasted bitterness, coffee. Sweet creamy sensation.

Kaffestout may not have the most inspired name, but if the shoe fits... There¬ís tons of coffee in here. And you¬íre pretty much given the chance to experience the full range of roasted bean sensations. Earthy and fruity. Bold and bright. Rich and bitter. There¬ís some touches of semi-sweet chocolate and charred malt. Even then, everything really goes back to coffee. If java¬ís your thing, it¬ís hard to ask for much more than that.

President Drumpf, tsjeeses, I need a beer AND a coffee. Problem solved. I fled to Bulgaria after the election and am not looking back. This brew is a thing of beauty from good ol¬í Tickeller, which is always good for a tick. Black as coal (not clean coal, there is no clean coal!) with a head as brown as the waste product of which Drumpf is a piece. Strong Turkish coffee aroma, molasses, some anise and dark chocolate. The flavor punches you in the gut like the election results. Medium sweet with a bitter finish, loads of coffee, so much that I doubt I¬íll sleep tonight. Medium full body, very slick feel. Great beer. Great country. You can¬ít get me here, Drumpf! Hahaha oh crap there¬ís a predator dro-

(33 cl. BB 07/03/19) Grosse t√™te brune, √©paisse et compl√®tement accroch√©e √† la paroi de mon verre. Liquide d¬íun noir des plus fonc√©s si cela peut faire du sens! Au nez, caf√© et poivrons, malts r√¥tis et balbutiements chocolat√©s avec une touche de cr√®me. En bouche, le caf√© est l√©g√®rement v√©g√©tal et chocolat√©. Notes de tabac √† pipe. Au palais, le corps est dense et sa texture est cr√©meuse. En finale, amertume de torr√©faction et de cacao cors√© qui ne manquent certainement pas de punch. Int√©ressant stout.

Draft.

A- Coffee, roasty, cocoa.

A- Black color, black liquid, off white head.

T- Coffee, slightly watery.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty finish.

O- Lots and lots of coffee, which was great. Just a bit thin though. Would have liked it to be a touch creamier.
Another fantastic Mikkeller beer, strong coffee aroma, with a creamy mouthfeel, very well balanced .
Bottle to snifter pour opaque black with huge mocha head. Nose dark chocolate, roasted malt, red fruit,coffee. Taste similar to nose with more roasted flavors, coco, and light ash. Nice mouth feel.
Almost black colour, large creamy brown head; aroma and taste of intensive coffe, some bitter cocoa powder and minimal ash; great stout!

6%ABV. Stout.

Poured out oily syrupy black. 40¬∫SRM.

Nose has smoke, burnt sugar and some latent florality; coffee. Aroma is a little thicker and slightly funkier than just coffee, with treacle, black honey, and liquid pei pa ko (local tasting note). Burnt grain and burnt charred wheat stalks, burnt dry grass.

Mouthfeel is light syrupy, elevated by some nice carbonation. Palate is characteristically stout with a carbon and ash lightness that is pleasing. Palate has some nice black bread and bread crumb flavors. Otherwise dominated as it should by charcoal, burnt twigs and ash. There are no fruity or sweet flavors. The overall palate is characterized by lightness and the bitter of carbon. There is a component light cream or creme fraiche.

The finish is light and airy, like the crema on a nicely pulled espresso.

Goes on Favorites List!
Bottle @ home, From Mikkeller. Pitch black pour with a huge frothy tan head. Notes of cocoa, milky chocolate, ground coffee, caramel and some light roast. Smoooooth!

Sampled on draft this beer poured a black color with a small creamy tan head that lingered and left excellent lacing. The aroma was strong brewed coffee with vanilla and cream. The flavor was roasty and bitter with strong brewed coffee and light cream. Very long brewed coffee finish. Medium bodied and smooth.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a creamy brown solid head. Aroma of fresh ground fruity coffee, roasted malts, caramel and cocoa. The taste is bitter, sweet and roasted with lots of coffee notes, roasted malts, dry cocoa, bitter chocolate and slight hoppy notes. Awesome balance and just an extremely enjoyable stout.
UPDATED: OCT 22, 2016 On tap at hopaholic. Pitch black colour good brown head. Nose is coldbrew coffee light roasted malts. Taste is strong coffee, roasted malt. Smooth mouthfeel. Good.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Kaffestout by Mikkeller at Mikkeller BarMocno dosc palony i faktycznie mocno kawowy, slodkawy, dosc lekki w odbiorze, szybko znika. BdbOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Tap@√∂lhus stockholm. black. Roasty charred dry coffee beans on nose, pretty nice actually. like sniffing a bag of fresh roasted coffee beans, with a bit of dry chocolate. med bodied, roasty, the coffee is all over. chocolate coffee, coffee beans, instant coffee. probably one of the most coffee- beany beers ive had. lots of it. all over.could manage with less.

Draught @ √òlhus K√∏benhavn. 
Poured pitch black in color with a thin but lasting brown head. 
Aroma clearly dominated by coffee and some chocolate. Lovely aroma really. 
Flavor has dark chocolate; pralines, strong coffee, roastedness, tobacco notes. Well if you dig coffee, this is a must. Lovely brew. Bodied for 6 abv.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2016 On draught at √òlhus K√∏benhavn, Helsinki. Dark brown with a creamy tan head. Glorious coffee smell but there is also some seriously heady milk chocolate (you know, the proper stuff) in the aroma. Sweet chocolatey taste with a bitter hop balance that progressively asserts in the finish. Ambrosial.

Tap @ Bevog Craft Beer Festival 2016. High creamy lasting light brown body. Pitch black body. Powerful roasted malt coffee caramel aroma. Powerful coffee liquorice flavor. Low carbonation, long finish. Well balanced with an alcohol level that seems just right.

On tap at Who Cares for Beer 2016 Beer Festival, Bevog Brewery, Bad Radkersburg, Austria. Shared with His Highness Kaiser und K√∂nig Igor and Rasta Teacher Mark. Pitch black, brown head. Intense coffee, nuts, roasty aroma. Sweet and roasty balance. Thick texture, very dry, light roasty finish. Very dry and aromatic stout. A true champion!

330ml bottle pours black in color with a massive brown head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee and dark roasted grains. Taste is a dark roasted grain and coffee bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a well crafted brew that suits the style nicely, with a nice balance of flavors, nothing overpowering. Recommended.

Jet black pour with an espresso head. Aroma is full on milk and coffee with a hint of roasted coffee. Lots of lace present. Medium to full bodied. Taste has a bitter finish, espresso and brewed coffee with hints of sugar and milk. Almost a cookie like thing going on here too.

0,2l from tap at Bevog Festival. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells of bitter herbs, coffee, light chilis, coffee grounds, nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of coffee grounds, bitter herbal, nettle, spices, lightly earthy, light caramel, some creaminess. finishes lightly roasty and bitter with notes of milk coffee, bitter herbs and some caramel. nice one, a bit too bitterish and not rounded enough but overall still quite nice thing.

Draught at Beerlovers Bar in Antwerp. Lightly lacing, thick, very densely structured, stable, pale beige head over an opaque black beer. Aroma of actual roasted coffee beans or even green coffee beans, bitter chocolate, butterscotch, vanilla beans, cappuccino, some natural iron, fudge, black peppercorns, peanuts. Restrained sweetishness in the onset, some dried fig, surrounded by dried meat-like umami and an underlying basic roasted barley sourishness which accompanies the rest of the palate, going through a nutty and roasted malt bitter middle with sweetish chocolatey and caramelly notes, ending in mouth-filling coffeeish roastedness further (and refinedly) accentuated by the actual coffee bean aroma retronasally, sharpened by a peppery hop bitterness. Nice, rounded and clean, of the standard quality I expect from Mikkeller.

33 cl bottle poured in to a Snifter. BBE March 2019. Pitch black with a creamy, tanned head. Roasted aroma with dark malts, chocolate, caramel and a good amount of coffee. Herbal hops and pines. Taste is bitter-roasted. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Good for the abv. Finishes lasting dry and roasted bitter with coffee and red berries. Excellent coffee Stout.
Drank with Rik while playing No Man¬ís Sky 01-09-16. Very nice beer. Lots of coffee taste. Excellent starter.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, african coffee, chocolate.
Appearance: jet black and brown head.
Taste: coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted dark malts, slightly ashy, nice malty backbone, smooth, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, coffee finish.
Overall: Great coffee stout, deep and complex.
Pours black, small grey head. Smell is pure coffee. Taste is Sharp, bitter coffee. Bit roasty. Agreeable mouthfeel and carbo. Very decent.

Pours a near black with a tan head. Rich coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel and hop aroma and flavors. Medium full body and moderate carbonation. Coffee and dark chocolate finish. On tap and Mikkeller Copenhagen.

33cl bottle. Very dark brown pour with a tall and fine-grained espresso head with excellent retention. Notes of roasted coffee, brewed coffee, cocoa, roasted malts, smoke, dark chocolate. Medium body and carbonation and a roasty bitter-sweet finish.

33 cl bottle. BBE 07.03.2019.
Pours pitch black color with a large and lasting beige head. Coffee is the first thing on the nose, lots of roasted malts, chocolate, subtle ashy cocoa, faint licorice and hops. Quite bitter roasted palate, malts, dry cocoa and chocolate on the flavor, coffee bitterness, subtle licorice saltiness. Carbonation is strong but makes the mouthfeel pleasantly fluffy, finish is dry and bitter. Quite nice and refined dry Stout.
4526
On tap at Beerlover¬ís Bar, Antwerp. Coffee, chocolate, malts, very nice and pleasant.
Bottle 330 ml. Almost black, tan foam. Aroma: natural coffee, sweetness of licorice, a little spice, hoppy. Taste: good coffee, dark chocolate, a drop of brandy, hops, roasted. Good coffee :)

Deep brown to black, opaque. Medium creamy tan head. Good retention. Coffee beans, earth, roasted malts on nose. Medium body. Dry taste with massive coffee. Some brandy. Earth. Roast. Light to medium bitterness. Good-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330 ml. bottle. BBF 07/03/19. Pours black, creamy deep chocolate mousse head, very creamy. The ideal gorgeous stout look. Nose is unfortunately quite grainy, burned coffee, coffee grounds, lightly metallic & a bit empty. Taste is black chocolate, coffee grounds, low milk chocolate, sweetness is low, grainy chocolate, faint plastic,¬Ö Not as thick as I hopped, whole feels a bit empty, sweetness is a bit too low, coffee is a bit too grainy,¬Ö Overall not bad, it has all the right elements in theory but they are not optimally utilizes, while the whole is not bad it is a bit subpar. There is low exotic sugar. This recipe might fare better expanded to a higher ABV. At this one price point one might expect more.
On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a small off-white head. Aroma of coffee beans and chocolate with a just a touch of stale cold coffee. Sweet roasted flavour with hints of chocolate and licorice

UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Great idea to create a rather low abv stout with added lactose and coffee. The aroma consists mostly of roasted malts, coffee and hops; but thankfully the flavour also has a nice amount of sweet flavours. This is Mikkeller at its best.
Bottle. Black color, huge beige head, oily texture. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, bittering hops. Taste is decent roasty, coffee, solid malty, decent bitter.good
Bottle at a tasting. Assertive coffee interplaying with relatively high residual sweetness and caramelly maltiness. Intense and balance, even though the coffee character is clearly not my favourite.
Bottle shared by lukka19, many thanks. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of strong coffee, sugary. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, bit sugary.

Bottle kindly shared by lukka19, many thanks. Dark brown color with medium white head. Dark malt, coffee, caramel in aroma. Taste, coffee, caramel, roasted malt, vanilla. Long coffee bitter finish. Very good.

Black. Roasted malt and coffee in the aroma and flavour, with a relatively dry taste, sour notes and medium bitterness. Full body. Overall, a very good coffee stout, but not the best of its kind. I would prefer it without the acidity.

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, strong roasty coffee beans, mocha, dark chocolate, some fruity hops in the finish. Flavour is moderate sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium. Tasty coffee stout.

pours black color, clear, with stable, creamy beige head. Aroma: intense roasted malts aroma, dark malts, which takes on coffee, mocha, bittersweet chocolate, roasted coffee beans. The same are flavors. Body is medium, texture very smooth, carbonation is low to medium.

sample from bottle, poured a black colour with a slight off head. nose is what you expect, coffee, roasted espresso beans, dark bitter chocolate aswell, mocha, bitter aftertaste. enjoyable coffee stout

Draft @ Taphouse, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty coffee aroma. Roasted malty caramel and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel and coffee finish.

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, frothy brown head. 
Nose has coffee, taste is sweet with clear notes of coffee. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

Black with a medium chocolatey fine poring head, good viscousity and lacings. Aromas of cocoa powder, dark chocolate and roasted coffee beans and roasted malts arise. Softly carbonated, bit slick and mouthcoating with a medium-full body. Bitter-sweet coffee-malt roast flavours with a light astringency. Lasting light roasty dry finish.
[5/14/16] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Black with a tan head. Strong roasty coffee aroma. Bittersweet flavor with lots of coffee, roast, a sourish note. Medium-bodied.
330 ml bottle, thanks Johan. Black with tanned head. Coffee, roasted malt and smooth stout. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

330ml bottle thanks to fonefan for sharing. Guest star: Skinnyviking. Lasting espresso head, jet black body, rings of lace down the glass. Coffee nose, dark fruity moments beneath. Roasted black coffee taste joined by chocolate moments and pine. Fine bodied. Pleasant coffee stout (Sunday drinking session at hotel L√∏ven, 15.05.2016).

Bottle shared with Fonefan. High creamy lasting light brown body. Pitch black body. Powerful roasted malt coffee caramel aroma. Powerful coffee liquorice flavor. Low carbonation, long finish. Well balanced with an alcohol level that seems just right.
Bottled:Black with a large head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. Soft mouh feel. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, caramel and some chocolate.

19.05.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is rich and slightly sweet, espresso, dark malts, dark sugar, caramel, roasted grain, minerals, toast, hops, pine needles, cocoa, licorice. Taste is slightly sour-ish burnt, weeds, roasted grain, burnt coffee, minerals, pine needles, hops, dark malts, dark sugar, licorice, burnt caramel, bark, toast. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly watery and mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle shared, thanks to Jan.
Black beer with a nice beige head. Coffee aroma, espresso dark chocolate some licorice, some fruits. Chocolate and coffee flavor, licorice, caramel, some tar. Quite nice.

Aroma is full of coffee and roasted malt, tones of dark chocolate. Pours black with a good, tan and frothy head. Rich flavour full of coffee, nice bitter finish. Feels thick, long after taste. Very nice beer.

Bottle. Black body with brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee with roasted malts, vanilla and dried fruits . Taste is roasted malts some cocoa and vanilla. Aftertaste is nice roasted malts bitterness with some malty dark caramel sweetness. Nice one.
From Tap. Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, mittelgro√üe cremige br√§unliche Schaumkrone. Geruch s√º√ü r√∂stmalzig, Kaffee, Vanille Milch. Geschmack r√∂stmalzig bitter, viel Kaffee, frisch ger√∂stete Bohnen.

From tap. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty, coffee and chocolate. Bitter, roasted, coffee and dark malty. Bitter and chocolate malty. Dry bitter and coffee finish.

Tap. Black body with a small tan head. Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate notes, bread and hoppy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Stout. üåüüåüüåüüåü
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and heavy coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 030516

Draught at Taphouse.
Black colored with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of coffee and caramel with notes of chocolate.
Roasted flavor of coffee with notes of chocolate and hoppy.
Roasted finish.
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, coffee and bitterness.

Aroma and taste is roasted malty and prominent roasted coffee, some mocha, coffee beans, nice mouthfeel, solid roasty into the finish.

smag: kaffe ristet malt chokoalde bitter m√∏rk chokolade

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of coffee, burnt malt. Black color with tan head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate malt bitter, light+ sweet. Full body, dry oily feel, avg. carb., coffee bitter finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich coffee, vegetables, roast malt, chocolate and hops. Nice long bitter finish with a good amount of coffee.

Draught @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of roast malt, rich coffee, expresso, dark chocolate. Flavor is rich malt, rich coffee, coffee beans, expresso, dark chocolate, toasted bread. Medium body, average carbonation, dry finish. 010516

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus, 6%. Almsot black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little espresso and hop. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, medium sweet, little liquroice, hop and medium bitter.
